an8.49:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṃ viharati pubbārāme migāramātupāsāde.
an8.49:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in the stilt longhouse of Migāra’s mother in the Eastern Monastery.

an8.49:1.2.pli: Atha kho visākhā migāramātā yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami …pe….
an8.49:1.2.eng: Then Visākhā, Migāra’s mother, went up to the Buddha, bowed, and sat down to one side.

an8.49:1.3.pli: Ekamantaṃ nisinnaṃ kho visākhaṃ migāramātaraṃ bhagavā etadavoca:

an8.49:2.1.pli: “Catūhi kho, visākhe, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo idhalokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, ayaṃsa loko āraddho hoti.
an8.49:2.1.eng: “Visākhā, a lady who has four qualities is practicing to win in this life, and she succeeds at it.

an8.49:2.3.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakammanto hoti, saṅgahitaparijano, bhattu manāpaṃ carati, sambhataṃ anurakkhati.
an8.49:2.3.eng: It’s when a lady is well-organized at work, manages the domestic help, acts lovingly toward her husband, and preserves his earnings.

an8.49:3.1.eng: And how is a lady well-organized at work?

an8.49:3.2.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo ye te bhattu abbhantarā kammantā—uṇṇāti vā kappāsāti vā—tattha dakkhā hoti analasā tatrupāyāya vīmaṃsāya samannāgatā alaṃ kātuṃ alaṃ saṃvidhātuṃ.
an8.49:3.2.eng: It’s when she’s deft and tireless in doing domestic duties for her husband, such as knitting and sewing. She understands how to go about things in order to complete and organize the work.

an8.49:3.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo susaṃvihitakammanto hoti.
an8.49:3.3.eng: That’s how a lady is well-organized at work.

an8.49:4.1.eng: And how does a lady manage the domestic help?

an8.49:4.2.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yo so bhattu abbhantaro antojano—dāsāti vā pessāti vā kammakarāti vā—
an8.49:4.2.eng: It’s when she knows what work her husband’s domestic bondservants, servants, and workers have completed, and what they’ve left incomplete.

an8.49:4.3.pli: tesaṃ katañca katato jānāti akatañca akatato jānāti, gilānakānañca balābalaṃ jānāti khādanīyaṃ bhojanīyañcassa paccaṃsena saṃvibhajati.
an8.49:4.3.eng: She knows who is sick, and who is fit or unwell. She distributes to each a fair portion of fresh and cooked foods.

an8.49:4.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo saṅgahitaparijano hoti.
an8.49:4.4.eng: That’s how a lady manages the domestic help.

an8.49:5.1.pli: Kathañca, visākhe, mātugāmo bhattu manāpaṃ carati?
an8.49:5.1.eng: And how does a lady act lovingly toward her husband?

an8.49:5.2.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattu amanāpasaṅkhātaṃ taṃ jīvitahetupi na ajjhācarati.
an8.49:5.2.eng: It’s when a lady would not transgress in any way that her husband would not consider agreeable, even for the sake of her own life.

an8.49:5.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo bhattu manāpaṃ carati.
an8.49:5.3.eng: That’s how a lady acts lovingly toward her husband.

an8.49:6.1.eng: And how does a lady preserve his earnings?

an8.49:6.2.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo yaṃ bhattā āharati dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā taṃ ārakkhena guttiyā sampādeti, tattha ca hoti adhuttī athenī asoṇḍī avināsikā.
an8.49:6.2.eng: It’s when she ensures that any income her husband earns is guarded and protected, whether money, grain, silver, or gold. She doesn’t overspend, steal, waste, or lose it.

an8.49:6.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo sambhataṃ anurakkhati.
an8.49:6.3.eng: That’s how a lady preserves his earnings.

an8.49:6.4.pli: Imehi kho, visākhe, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo idhalokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, ayaṃsa loko āraddho hoti.
an8.49:6.4.eng: A lady who possesses these four qualities is practicing to win in this life, and she succeeds at it.

an8.49:7.1.pli: Catūhi kho, visākhe, dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo paralokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraloko āraddho hoti.
an8.49:7.1.eng: A lady who has four qualities is practicing to win in the next life, and she succeeds at it.

an8.49:7.3.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo saddhāsampanno hoti, sīlasampanno hoti, cāgasampanno hoti, paññāsampanno hoti.
an8.49:7.3.eng: It’s when a lady is accomplished in faith, ethics, generosity, and wisdom.

an8.49:8.1.eng: And how is a lady accomplished in faith?

an8.49:8.2.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo saddho hoti, saddahati tathāgatassa bodhiṃ:
an8.49:8.2.eng: It’s when a lady has faith in the Realized One’s awakening:

an8.49:8.3.pli: ‘itipi so bhagavā arahaṃ sammāsambuddho vijjācaraṇasampanno sugato lokavidū anuttaro purisadammasārathi satthā devamanussānaṃ buddho bhagavā’ti.
an8.49:8.3.eng: ‘That Blessed One is perfected, a fully awakened Buddha, accomplished in knowledge and conduct, holy, knower of the world, supreme guide for those fit for training, teacher of gods and humans, awakened, blessed.’

an8.49:8.4.pli: Evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo saddhāsampanno hoti.
an8.49:8.4.eng: That’s how a lady is accomplished in faith.

an8.49:9.1.eng: And how is a lady accomplished in ethics?

an8.49:9.2.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo pāṇātipātā paṭivirato hoti …pe… surāmerayamajjapamādaṭṭhānā paṭivirato hoti.
an8.49:9.2.eng: It’s when a lady doesn’t kill living creatures, steal, commit sexual misconduct, lie, or consume beer, wine, and liquor intoxicants.

an8.49:9.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo sīlasampanno hoti.
an8.49:9.3.eng: That’s how a lady is accomplished in ethics.

an8.49:10.1.eng: And how is a lady accomplished in generosity?

an8.49:10.2.pli: Idha, visākhe, mātugāmo vigatamalamaccherena cetasā agāraṃ ajjhāvasati muttacāgā payatapāṇinī vossaggaratā yācayogā dānasaṃvibhāgaratā.
an8.49:10.2.eng: It’s when she lives at home rid of the stain of stinginess, freely generous, open-handed, loving to let go, committed to charity, loving to give and to share.

an8.49:10.3.pli: Evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo cāgasampanno hoti.
an8.49:10.3.eng: That’s how a lady is accomplished in generosity.

an8.49:11.1.eng: And how is a lady accomplished in wisdom?

an8.49:11.2.eng: It’s when a lady is wise. She has the wisdom of arising and passing away which is noble, penetrative, and leads to the complete ending of suffering.

an8.49:11.3.pli: evaṃ kho, visākhe, mātugāmo paññāsampanno hoti.
an8.49:11.3.eng: That’s how a lady is accomplished in wisdom.

an8.49:12.1.pli: Imehi kho, visākhe, catūhi dhammehi samannāgato mātugāmo paralokavijayāya paṭipanno hoti, paraloko āraddho hotīti.
an8.49:12.1.eng: A lady who possesses these four qualities is practicing to win in the next life, and she succeeds at it.

an8.49:14.4.eng: to well-being in lives to come.

an8.49:15.1.eng: And so, a lady in whom

an8.49:16.3.eng: a virtuous laywoman such as she

an8.49:16.4.eng: is reborn in the realm of the Agreeable Gods.”

an8.5:1.1.pli: “Aṭṭhime, bhikkhave, lokadhammā lokaṃ anuparivattanti, loko ca aṭṭha lokadhamme anuparivattati.
an8.5:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, the eight worldly conditions revolve around the world, and the world revolves around the eight worldly conditions.

an8.5:1.3.pli: Lābho ca, alābho ca, yaso ca, ayaso ca, nindā ca, pasaṃsā ca, sukhañca, dukkhañca.
an8.5:1.3.eng: Gain and loss, fame and disgrace, blame and praise, pleasure and pain.

an8.5:1.4.pli: Ime kho, bhikkhave, aṭṭha lokadhammā lokaṃ anuparivattanti, loko ca ime aṭṭha lokadhamme anuparivattatīti.
an8.5:1.4.eng: These eight worldly conditions revolve around the world, and the world revolves around these eight worldly conditions.

an8.5:2.1.eng: Gain and loss, fame and disgrace,

an8.5:2.2.eng: blame and praise, and pleasure and pain.

an8.5:2.3.eng: These qualities among mankind are impermanent,

an8.5:3.1.eng: An intelligent and mindful person knows these things,

an8.5:3.3.eng: Desirable things don’t disturb their mind,

an8.5:3.4.eng: nor are they repelled by the undesirable.

an8.5:4.2.eng: are cleared and disappeared, they are no more.

an8.5:4.4.eng: they who have gone beyond rebirth <j>understand rightly.”

an8.51:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sakkesu viharati kapilavatthusmiṃ nigrodhārāme.
an8.51:1.1.eng: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sakyans, near Kapilavatthu in the Banyan Tree Monastery.

an8.51:1.2.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ aṭṭhāsi. Ekamantaṃ ṭhitā kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.51:1.2.eng: Then Mahāpajāpati Gotamī went up to the Buddha, bowed, stood to one side, and said to him:

an8.51:1.3.pli: “sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:1.3.eng: “Sir, please let ladies gain the going forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:1.5.pli: Mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjā”ti.
an8.51:1.5.eng: Don’t endorse the going forth for ladies from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:2.1.pli: Dutiyampi kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:

an8.51:2.2.pli: “sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.

an8.51:2.4.pli: Mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjā”ti.

an8.51:3.1.pli: Tatiyampi kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.51:3.1.eng: For a third time, Mahāpajāpati Gotamī said to the Buddha:

an8.51:3.2.pli: “sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:3.2.eng: “Sir, please let ladies gain the going forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:3.4.pli: Mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjā”ti.
an8.51:3.4.eng: Don’t endorse the going forth for ladies from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:4.1.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī “na bhagavā anujānāti mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti dukkhī dummanā assumukhī rudamānā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā padakkhiṇaṃ katvā pakkāmi.
an8.51:4.1.eng: Then Mahāpajāpati Gotamī thought, “The Buddha does not permit ladies to go forth.” Miserable and sad, weeping, with a tearful face, she bowed, and respectfully circled the Buddha, keeping him on her right, before leaving.

an8.51:5.1.pli: Atha kho bhagavā kapilavatthusmiṃ yathābhirantaṃ viharitvā yena vesālī tena cārikaṃ pakkāmi.
an8.51:5.1.eng: When the Buddha had stayed in Kapilavatthu as long as he pleased, he set out for Vesālī.

an8.51:5.2.pli: Anupubbena cārikaṃ caramāno yena vesālī tadavasari.
an8.51:5.2.eng: Traveling stage by stage, he arrived at Vesālī,

an8.51:5.3.pli: Tatra sudaṃ bhagavā vesāliyaṃ viharati mahāvane kūṭāgārasālāyaṃ.
an8.51:5.3.eng: where he stayed at the Great Wood, in the hall with the peaked roof.

an8.51:5.4.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī kese chedāpetvā kāsāyāni vatthāni acchādetvā sambahulāhi sākiyānīhi saddhiṃ yena vesālī tena pakkāmi.
an8.51:5.4.eng: Then Mahāpajāpati Gotamī had her hair shaved, and dressed in ocher robes. Together with several Sakyan ladies she set out for Vesālī.

an8.51:5.5.pli: Anupubbena yena vesālī mahāvanaṃ kūṭāgārasālā tenupasaṅkami.
an8.51:5.5.eng: Traveling stage by stage, she arrived at Vesālī and went to the Great Wood, the hall with the peaked roof.

an8.51:5.6.pli: Atha kho mahāpajāpatī gotamī sūnehi pādehi rajokiṇṇena gattena dukkhī dummanā assumukhī rudamānā bahidvārakoṭṭhake aṭṭhāsi.
an8.51:5.6.eng: Then Mahāpajāpati Gotamī stood crying outside the gate, her feet swollen, her limbs covered with dust, miserable and sad, with tearful face.

an8.51:6.1.pli: Addasā kho āyasmā ānando mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ sūnehi pādehi rajokiṇṇena gattena dukkhiṃ dummanaṃ assumukhiṃ rudamānaṃ bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitaṃ.
an8.51:6.1.eng: Venerable Ānanda saw her standing there,

an8.51:6.3.pli: “kiṃ nu tvaṃ, gotami, sūnehi pādehi rajokiṇṇena gattena dukkhī dummanā assumukhī rudamānā bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitā”ti?
an8.51:6.3.eng: “Gotamī, why do you stand crying outside the gate, your feet swollen, your limbs covered with dust, miserable and sad, with tearful face?”

an8.51:6.4.pli: “Tathā hi pana, bhante ānanda, na bhagavā anujānāti mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:6.4.eng: “Honorable Ānanda, it’s because the Buddha does not permit ladies to go forth in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:6.5.pli: “Tena hi tvaṃ, gotami, muhuttaṃ idheva tāva hohi, yāvāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ yācāmi mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:6.5.eng: “Well then, Gotamī, wait here an hour while I ask the Buddha to grant the going forth for ladies.”

an8.51:7.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.51:7.1.eng: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

an8.51:7.2.pli: “esā, bhante, mahāpajāpatī gotamī sūnehi pādehi rajokiṇṇena gattena dukkhī dummanā assumukhī rudamānā bahidvārakoṭṭhake ṭhitā:
an8.51:7.2.eng: “Sir, Mahāpajāpati Gotamī is standing crying outside the gate, her feet swollen, her limbs covered with dust, miserable and sad, with tearful face.

an8.51:7.3.pli: ‘na bhagavā anujānāti mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan’ti.
an8.51:7.3.eng: She says that it’s because the Buddha does not permit ladies to go forth.

an8.51:7.4.pli: Sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:7.4.eng: Sir, please let ladies gain the going forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:7.6.pli: Mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjā”ti.
an8.51:7.6.eng: Don’t endorse the going forth for ladies from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:8.2.pli: tatiyampi kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.51:8.2.eng: For a third time, Ānanda said to the Buddha:

an8.51:8.3.pli: “sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:8.3.eng: “Sir, please let ladies gain the going forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:8.5.pli: Mā te rucci mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjā”ti.
an8.51:8.5.eng: Don’t endorse the going forth for ladies from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:9.2.pli: “na bhagavā anujānāti mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ.
an8.51:9.2.eng: “The Buddha does not permit ladies to go forth.

an8.51:9.3.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ aññenapi pariyāyena bhagavantaṃ yāceyyaṃ mātugāmassa tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:9.3.eng: Why don’t I try another approach?”

an8.51:9.4.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.51:9.4.eng: Then Venerable Ānanda said to the Buddha,

an8.51:9.5.pli: “bhabbo nu kho, bhante, mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitvā sotāpattiphalaṃ vā sakadāgāmiphalaṃ vā anāgāmiphalaṃ vā arahattaphalaṃ vā sacchikātun”ti?
an8.51:9.5.eng: “Sir, is a lady able to realize the fruits of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, and perfection once she has gone forth?”

an8.51:9.6.pli: “Bhabbo, ānanda, mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitvā sotāpattiphalampi sakadāgāmiphalampi anāgāmiphalampi arahattaphalampi sacchikātun”ti.

an8.51:9.7.pli: “Sace, bhante, bhabbo mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajitvā sotāpattiphalampi …pe… arahattaphalampi sacchikātuṃ;
an8.51:9.7.eng: “If a lady is able to realize the fruits of stream-entry, once-return, non-return, and perfection once she has gone forth.

an8.51:9.8.pli: bahukārā, bhante, mahāpajāpatī gotamī bhagavato mātucchā āpādikā posikā khīrassa dāyikā;
an8.51:9.8.eng: Sir, Mahāpajāpati has been very helpful to the Buddha. She is his aunt who raised him, nurtured him, and gave him her milk.

an8.51:9.9.eng: When the Buddha’s birth mother passed away, she nurtured him at her own breast.

an8.51:9.10.pli: Sādhu, bhante, labheyya mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjan”ti.
an8.51:9.10.eng: Sir, please let ladies gain the going forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One.”

an8.51:10.1.pli: “Sace, ānanda, mahāpajāpatī gotamī aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇhāti, sāvassā hotu upasampadā—
an8.51:10.1.eng: “Ānanda, if Mahāpajāpati Gotamī accepts these eight principles of respect, that will be her ordination.

an8.51:11.1.pli: Vassasatūpasampannāya bhikkhuniyā tadahūpasampannassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ kattabbaṃ.
an8.51:11.1.eng: A nun, even if she has been ordained for a hundred years, should bow down to a monk who was ordained that very day. She should rise up for him, greet him with joined palms, and observe proper etiquette toward him.

an8.51:11.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:11.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:12.1.pli: Na bhikkhuniyā abhikkhuke āvāse vassaṃ upagantabbaṃ.
an8.51:12.1.eng: A nun should not commence the rainy season residence in a monastery without monks.

an8.51:12.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:12.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:13.1.pli: Anvaḍḍhamāsaṃ bhikkhuniyā bhikkhusaṅghato dve dhammā paccāsīsitabbā—
an8.51:13.1.eng: Each fortnight the nuns should expect two things from the community of monks:

an8.51:13.2.eng: the date of the sabbath, and visiting for advice.

an8.51:13.3.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:13.3.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:14.1.pli: Vassaṃvuṭṭhāya bhikkhuniyā ubhatosaṅghe tīhi ṭhānehi pavāretabbaṃ—
an8.51:14.1.eng: After completing the rainy season residence the nuns should invite admonition from the communities of both monks and nuns in regard to anything that was

an8.51:14.2.pli: diṭṭhena vā sutena vā parisaṅkāya vā.

an8.51:14.3.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:14.3.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:15.1.pli: Garudhammaṃ ajjhāpannāya bhikkhuniyā ubhatosaṅghe pakkhamānattaṃ caritabbaṃ.
an8.51:15.1.eng: A nun who has committed a grave offense should undergo penance in the communities of both monks and nuns for a fortnight.

an8.51:15.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:15.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:16.1.pli: Dve vassāni chasu dhammesu sikkhitasikkhāya sikkhamānāya ubhatosaṅghe upasampadā pariyesitabbā.
an8.51:16.1.eng: A trainee nun who has trained in the six rules for two years should seek ordination from the communities of both monks and nuns.

an8.51:16.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:16.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:17.1.pli: Na kenaci pariyāyena bhikkhuniyā bhikkhu akkositabbo paribhāsitabbo.
an8.51:17.1.eng: A nun should not abuse or insult a monk in any way.

an8.51:17.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:17.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:18.1.pli: Ajjatagge ovaṭo bhikkhunīnaṃ bhikkhūsu vacanapatho, anovaṭo bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīsu vacanapatho.
an8.51:18.1.eng: From this day forth it is forbidden for nuns to criticize monks, but it is not forbidden for monks to criticize nuns.

an8.51:18.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:18.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:19.1.pli: Sace, ānanda, mahāpajāpatī gotamī ime aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇhāti, sāvassā hotu upasampadā”ti.
an8.51:19.1.eng: If Mahāpajāpati Gotamī accepts these eight principles of respect, that will be her ordination.”

an8.51:20.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando bhagavato santike ime aṭṭha garudhamme uggahetvā yena mahāpajāpatī gotamī tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā mahāpajāpatiṃ gotamiṃ etadavoca:
an8.51:20.1.eng: Then Ānanda, having learned these eight principles of respect from the Buddha himself, went to Mahāpajāpati Gotamī and said:

an8.51:21.1.pli: “Sace kho tvaṃ, gotami, aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇheyyāsi, sāva te bhavissati upasampadā—
an8.51:21.1.eng: “Gotamī, if you accept eight principles of respect, that will be your ordination.

an8.51:22.1.pli: Vassasatūpasampannāya bhikkhuniyā tadahūpasampannassa bhikkhuno abhivādanaṃ paccuṭṭhānaṃ añjalikammaṃ sāmīcikammaṃ kattabbaṃ.
an8.51:22.1.eng: A nun, even if she has been ordained for a hundred years, should bow down to a monk who was ordained that very day. She should rise up for him, greet him with joined palms, and observe proper etiquette toward him.

an8.51:22.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo …pe….
an8.51:22.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts. …

an8.51:23.1.pli: Ajjatagge ovaṭo bhikkhunīnaṃ bhikkhūsu vacanapatho, anovaṭo bhikkhūnaṃ bhikkhunīsu vacanapatho.
an8.51:23.1.eng: From this day forth it is forbidden for nuns to criticize monks, but it is not forbidden for monks to criticize nuns.

an8.51:23.2.pli: Ayampi dhammo sakkatvā garuṃ katvā mānetvā pūjetvā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyo.
an8.51:23.2.eng: This principle should be honored, respected, esteemed, and venerated, and not transgressed so long as life lasts.

an8.51:23.3.pli: Sace kho tvaṃ, gotami, ime aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇheyyāsi, sāva te bhavissati upasampadā”ti.
an8.51:23.3.eng: If you accept these eight principles of respect, that will be your ordination.”

an8.51:24.1.pli: “Seyyathāpi, bhante ānanda, itthī vā puriso vā daharo yuvā maṇḍanakajātiko sīsaṃnhāto uppalamālaṃ vā vassikamālaṃ vā adhimuttakamālaṃ vā labhitvā ubhohi hatthehi paṭiggahetvā uttamaṅge sirasmiṃ patiṭṭhāpeyya;
an8.51:24.1.eng: “Ānanda, suppose there was a woman or man who was young, youthful, and fond of adornments, and had bathed their head. After getting a garland of lotuses, jasmine, or liana flowers, they would take them in both hands and place them on the crown of the head.

an8.51:24.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho ahaṃ, bhante ānanda, ime aṭṭha garudhamme paṭiggaṇhāmi yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīye”ti.
an8.51:24.2.eng: In the same way, sir, I accept these eight principles of respect as not to be transgressed so long as life lasts.”

an8.51:25.1.pli: Atha kho āyasmā ānando yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho āyasmā ānando bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
an8.51:25.1.eng: Then Venerable Ānanda went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to the Buddha:

an8.51:25.2.pli: “paṭiggahitā, bhante, mahāpajāpatiyā gotamiyā aṭṭha garudhammā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyā”ti.
an8.51:25.2.eng: “Sir, Mahāpajāpati Gotamī has accepted the eight principles of respect as not to be transgressed so long as life lasts.”

an8.51:26.1.pli: “Sace, ānanda, nālabhissa mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, ciraṭṭhitikaṃ, ānanda, brahmacariyaṃ abhavissa, vassasahassameva saddhammo tiṭṭheyya.
an8.51:26.1.eng: “Ānanda, if ladies had not gained the going forth from the lay life to homelessness in the teaching and training proclaimed by the Realized One, the spiritual life would have lasted long. The true teaching would have remained for a thousand years.

an8.51:26.2.pli: Yato ca kho, ānanda, mātugāmo tathāgatappavedite dhammavinaye agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajito, na dāni, ānanda, brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ bhavissati.
an8.51:26.2.eng: But since they have gained the going forth, now the spiritual life will not last long.

an8.51:26.3.pli: Pañceva dāni, ānanda, vassasatāni saddhammo ṭhassati.
an8.51:26.3.eng: The true teaching will remain only five hundred years.

an8.51:27.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, yāni kānici kulāni bahutthikāni appapurisakāni, tāni suppadhaṃsiyāni honti corehi kumbhatthenakehi;
an8.51:27.1.eng: It’s like those families with many women and few men. They’re easy prey for bandits and grain-jar thieves.

an8.51:27.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.
an8.51:27.2.eng: In the same way, the spiritual life does not last long in a teaching and training where ladies gain the going forth.

an8.51:28.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, sampanne sālikkhette setaṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ sālikkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti;
an8.51:28.1.eng: It’s like a field full of rice. Once the disease called ‘white bones’ attacks, it doesn’t last long.

an8.51:28.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.
an8.51:28.2.eng: In the same way, the spiritual life does not last long in a teaching and training where ladies gain the going forth.

an8.51:29.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, sampanne ucchukkhette mañjiṭṭhikā nāma rogajāti nipatati, evaṃ taṃ ucchukkhettaṃ na ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti;
an8.51:29.1.eng: It’s like a field full of sugar cane. Once the disease called ‘red rot’ attacks, it doesn’t last long.

an8.51:29.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, ānanda, yasmiṃ dhammavinaye labhati mātugāmo agārasmā anagāriyaṃ pabbajjaṃ, na taṃ brahmacariyaṃ ciraṭṭhitikaṃ hoti.
an8.51:29.2.eng: In the same way, the spiritual life does not last long in a teaching and training where ladies gain the going forth.

an8.51:30.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, ānanda, puriso mahato taḷākassa paṭikacceva āḷiṃ bandheyya yāvadeva udakassa anatikkamanāya;
an8.51:30.1.eng: As a man might build a dyke around a large lake as a precaution against the water overflowing,

an8.51:30.2.pli: evamevaṃ kho, ānanda, mayā paṭikacceva bhikkhunīnaṃ aṭṭha garudhammā paññattā yāvajīvaṃ anatikkamanīyā”ti.
an8.51:30.2.eng: in the same way as a precaution I’ve prescribed the eight principles of respect as not to be transgressed so long as life lasts.”
